workflow.name: Automated CV anonymization for GDPR compliance with GPT-4 and Stirling PDF
workflow.description:
## Overview
Automatically anonymize CVs/resumes while preserving professional information. Perfect for recruitment agencies ensuring GDPR compliance and bias-free hiring.

## Features
- Supports multiple file formats (PDF, DOCX, etc.)
- Multi-language support (preserves original language)
- Removes PII: names, emails, phones, addresses
- Preserves: skills, experience, dates, achievements
- Outputs professionally formatted PDF

## Requirements
- OpenAI API key (GPT-4 recommended)
- Stirling PDF service (self-hosted or cloud)
- n8n version 1.0+

## Setup Instructions
1. Configure OpenAI credentials
2. Set up Stirling PDF API endpoint
3. Update API key in HTTP Request nodes
4. Activate workflow
5. Test with sample CV

## Usage
POST to webhook endpoint with CV file as `UploadCV` field.

## Use Cases
- Recruitment agencies (GDPR compliance)
- HR departments (bias-free screening)
- Job boards (candidate privacy)

messageValues.message:
=You are an expert CV anonymization system.

CRITICAL TASK: Transform the CV text provided in the user message into a clean, anonymized, professionally formatted HTML document.

LANGUAGE HANDLING ‚Äî ABSOLUTE RULE:
- The input CV may be written in ANY language.
- The anonymized CV MUST remain FULLY in the ORIGINAL language of the input.

ANONYMIZATION RULES ‚Äî FOLLOW EXACTLY:

1. Replace ALL personally identifiable information with language-matching placeholders:
   - Full names ‚Üí localized equivalent of ‚Äú[CANDIDATE NAME]‚Äù
   - Email addresses ‚Üí localized equivalent of ‚Äú[EMAIL REDACTED]‚Äù
   - Phone numbers ‚Üí localized equivalent of ‚Äú[PHONE REDACTED]‚Äù
   - Full addresses ‚Üí keep only country/region (localized)
   - Specific city names ‚Üí remove or replace with localized ‚Äú[CITY]‚Äù
   - Company names ‚Üí localized descriptive replacements
   - University / school names ‚Üí localized ‚Äú[TOP UNIVERSITY]‚Äù equivalent
   - Client names ‚Üí localized ‚Äú[CLIENT NAME]‚Äù equivalent
   - Any other personal names ‚Üí localized ‚Äú[NAME]‚Äù

   IMPORTANT:
   - Do NOT translate the CV.
   - Use natural, professional wording in the CV‚Äôs language.
   - Do NOT translate Placeholders.

2. PRESERVE exactly as written from the input CV:
   - Job titles
   - Skills and technologies
   - Years and dates
   - Achievements and metrics
   - Certifications (remove issuer name only)
   - Work experience descriptions word-for-word
   - Testimonials (names anonymized only)
   - Original language, grammar, and writing style

HTML STRUCTURE REQUIREMENTS:
- Complete HTML5 document with <!DOCTYPE html>
- Embedded CSS in <style> tag
- Use Arial or sans-serif font family
- Professional color scheme
- Centered H1 using localized candidate name placeholder
- Proper RTL support if the language requires it
- Maximum width: 800px, centered layout

OUTPUT FORMAT ‚Äî CRITICAL:
Return ONLY a valid JSON object:
{"html": "complete HTML document as a single escaped string"}

FORMATTING RULES:
- Escape all double quotes
- Single continuous JSON string
- NO markdown
- NO comments
- NO extra text

VERIFICATION BEFORE RESPONDING:
1. Language of output matches input CV exactly
2. No English text appears unless the CV itself is English
3. Placeholders are professional
4. Skills, titles, and metrics are preserved
5. Output is valid JSON with only the "html" key

parameters.content:
# CV Anonymization Workflow

Automatically removes personally identifiable information from CVs while preserving skills, experience, and achievements.

### How it works

1. **File Upload**: Webhook receives CV files (PDF, DOCX, etc.) via POST request
2. **PDF Conversion**: Non-PDF files are converted to PDF format using Stirling PDF
3. **Page Splitting**: Multi-page PDFs are split into individual pages for accurate processing
4. **Text Extraction**: Each page is converted to plain text
5. **AI Anonymization**: GPT-4 removes all PII (names, emails, phones, addresses) while maintaining original language and preserving job titles, skills, dates, and achievements
6. **HTML Generation**: Creates professionally formatted HTML output with structured layout
7. **PDF Output**: Converts anonymized HTML back to PDF and returns via webhook

### Setup steps

1. Configure OpenAI credentials for all three OpenAI Chat Model nodes
2. Add Stirling PDF authorization headers to HTTP Request nodes (Any file to pdf, Split PDF Pages1, PDF ‚Üí Text1, Any File ‚Üí PDF2)
3. Test webhook endpoint with sample CV file

### Customization

- Adjust anonymization rules in Basic LLM Chain system message
- Modify HTML styling requirements in the prompt
- Change GPT model versions for cost/quality tradeoffs

## File Input & Conversion
Webhook receives files ‚Üí If checks format ‚Üí converts to PDF if needed

## PDF Processing & Text Extraction
Split pages ‚Üí decompress ‚Üí extract text from each page ‚Üí aggregate all text

## AI Anonymization
GPT-4 removes PII, preserves skills/experience, maintains original language, outputs structured HTML

## Output Generation
Extract HTML ‚Üí convert to PDF ‚Üí return via webhook

‚ö†Ô∏è STIRLING PDF AUTH REQUIRED

All 4 Stirling PDF HTTP nodes need Authorization headers configured before this workflow will function.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Compression node is useful when you want to compress files to either gzip or zip format. You can even use this node to decompress your gzip and zip files.
The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
